review_text:
I stayed here for 2 weeks for temporary work in Gallup. Overall this place worked out well and I would recommend it to others.
Pros:
-Convenient location, short drive (or even walk) to hospitals, many food options. Area feels very safe.
-Good sized space, larger than I expected from the photos. The bathroom is quite large as well, plenty of room for suitcases/hanging and storing clothes/etc. I appreciated having a couch in addition to the bed.
-Quite a few kitchen utensils and appliances which made it easier to have meals there instead of eating out for every meal. Mini-fridge available.
-Alray promptly responded to any questions or concerns
Minor reservations:
-The space is not 100% private. You enter through a locked door to the bedroom/kitchen/living area, then another door to a hallway, then a separate door to the bathroom. In the hallway area there is another door (to the garage perhaps?) and a staircase that leads up to the rest of the house. The staircase is covered with a curtain, but not a door. Although this was never a problem during my stay, I was surprised to see part of the space was separated by a curtain rather than a lock-able door. It -is- possible to lock the door between the bedroom and hallway, thus keeping only the bedroom private.
-The dogs were friendly, but I am generally comfortable around dogs. They are big and will greet you when exiting the space. They also bark during the day. There are other neighborhood dogs that also bark loudly (no fault of these dogs or their owners). It wasn't bothersome since I worked during the day and wasn't in the space.
-Since this is a ground-level space, I noticed some ants. There was Raid available and Alray promptly contacted an exterminator to spray the outside of the home the next day.
-This is a good space for 1 or 2 adults. It would be uncomfortable for any children or more than 2 people.
